summary: This is a brief email from a Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, inquiring if the recipient will join a call regarding the Epstein case. It indicates internal coordination within the prosecution team.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: The sender of the email, a prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, is inquiring about joining an Epstein-related call.

events.title: Epstein Call Coordination
events.description: A Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit emails a colleague to ask if they will join a call regarding the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The email is internal correspondence within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
It references an upcoming call specifically about the Epstein case.
The sender holds the title of Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, indicating the unit's involvement.
The email is dated June 1, 2020, showing post-arrest case activity.
